In addition, any unit that has been the target of a Shooting Attack made by a unit with searchlights (regardless of whether any Hits were inflicted or not) may be freely targeted for Shooting Attacks by any other unit in the same Shooting phase, ignoring the 24" restriction to line of sight imposed by the Night Fighting rules.

Searchlights do not count as weapons and may not be targeted by the Weapon Destroyed result on the Vehicle Damage table.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a dozer blade may re-roll all failed Dangerous Terrain tests made for it.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The controlling player may choose to trigger smoke launchers once a model with them has completed its movement in the Movement phase, and may only choose to trigger them if the model has moved no faster than Combat Speed that turn. Once triggered, the model with smoke launchers counts as being more than 25% obscured, regardless of terrain, until the start of the controlling player’s next turn and gains a 6+ Cover Save. A model whose smoke launchers have been triggered may not make any Shooting Attacks, except as part of a Reaction, in the same turn. Smoke launchers may only be used once per battle, and once triggered may not be further used – in addition, they do not count as a weapon and may not be targeted by Weapon Destroyed results on the Vehicle Damage table.

sharedSelectionEntries.name: Four Hull (Front) Mounted Storm Eagle Rockets

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Reach (3), Brutal (2), Breaching (5+), Specialist Weapon, Devastating Charge

sharedSelectionEntries.name: Ripper Gun and Close Combat Weapon

rules.name: Moving Bulwark
rules.description: If an attack draws any line of sight through a unit with the Moving Bulwark special rule, targeting any friendly unit with the Infantry Type, then said targeted unit may benefit from a 4+ Cover Save.

sharedSelectionEntries.name: Two Centerline Mounted Multiple Rocket Pods
Two Sponson Mounted Belt-fed Heavy Stubbers
Two Sponson Mounted Lascannons and Gravis Heavy Bolters
Two Sponson Mounted Gravis Heavy Bolters
Two Sponson Mounted Targeters and Gravis Heavy Bolters
Two Turret Mounted Twin-linked Heavy Bolters
Two Centerline Mounted Typhoon Missile Launchers
Two Sponson Mounted Gravis Heavy Bolter Batteries
Two Sponson Mounted Gravis Autocannon Batteries
Two Sponson Mounted Hurricane Bolter Arrays
Cyclone Missile Launcher and Storm Bolter

modifiers.value: If {this} is selected, then all other models that are part of the same unit must be upgraded with {this} in the same manner.

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Death Company, Black Rage, Sanguinary Guard, Sanguinary Priests, Baal Predator Modification, Overcharged Engines, Relics of Baal, Death Mask

rules.name: Death Company
rules.description: Any Lamenters Assault Squad, Siege Assault Squad, or Tactical Squad, may be upgraded to death company for 5+ points a model. The unit gains the Fearless, Furious Charge (1), Rage (1), Feel No Pain (6+) and The Black Rage Special Rule. Each model also gains +1 Attack and can access Weapons upgrades as if they each were a Sergeant. These units lose Line and cannot score/deny objectives. Any unit upgraded in such a way remains in its current Force Organization slot, even if they would normally be moved by a Company Level Deployment.

rules.name: Sanguinary Guard
rules.description: A Lamenters Command Squad that is not mounted on Astartes Combat Bikes may be upgraded to Sanguinary Guard for +15 points per model. They replace their Bolter and Chainsword with an Angelus Boltgun and Encarmine Sword/Axe and gain Death Masks. They also receive the Furious Charge (1) and Stubborn Special Rules.

rules.name: Sanguinary Priests
rules.description: Any model equipped with Narthecium may be upgraded to a Sanguinary Priest for + 25 points. All Infantry models with Chapter Tactics (Lamenters) in a unit that includes at least one Sanguinary Priest adds +1 to their Weapon Skill.

rules.name: Baal Predator Modification
rules.description:
A Lamenters Predator may be upgraded to represent the anachronous Baal model employed by the sons of Sanguinius for +30 points.

A Baal Predator replaces its Turret Mounted weapon with a Twin- Linked Assault Cannon, which it may swap freely for a Flamestorm cannon. A Baal Predator also freely gains Overcharged Engines wargear. The Baal Predator, may not however upgrade its Sponson Weapons to Lascannons.

rules.name: Overcharged Engines
rules.description: Any Rhino Based vehicle (Razorback, Predator, Whirlwind etc) may be upgraded to have Overcharged Engines for +15 points per model. If done so the model gains the (Fast) Vehicle Sub-Type in addition to all those it already had.

rules.name: Relics of Baal
rules.description: Any model with the Character Sub-Type and the Chapter Tactics (Lamenters) Special Rule may exchange any Power Weapon to an Encarmine Sword or Axe for +5 points. They May also exchange their Bolt Gun or Bolt Pistol for an Angelus Boltgun for +2 Points.

rules.name: Death Mask
rules.description: Any model with the Independent Character and Chapter Tactics (Lamenters) Special rule may be equipped with a Death Mask for +15 points each. A Death Mask gives the model wearing it the Fear (1) and Stubborn Special Rules.

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Death-speaker Chaplains, Slaughter-tallies, Aetheling, Sons of the Executioners

rules.name: Death-speaker Chaplain
rules.description:
Any Number of Force Commanders may be upgraded to Death-Speaker Chaplains for +35 points. This ignores the normal limitations on Chapter Specialists.


A Death- Speaker Chaplain, and all models in a unit he joins, gains the Stubborn and Hatred (Everything!) special rules. In addition, the Chaplain increases his Leadership Characteristic to 10. They also gain the Slaughter-Tallies Special rule.

rules.name: Slaughter-tallies
rules.description: Any enemy with the character sub-type that is slain in a Challenge within 6" of a Death-Speaker Chaplain gains The Executioners player an extra Victory Point.

rules.name: Aetheling
rules.description: An Executioners Captain may be upgraded to an Aetheling for 10 points. An Aetheling gains the Counter-Attack (1) special rule and confers the Furious Charge Special Rule on a squad he joins.

rules.name: Sons of the Executioner
rules.description: All models in an Executioners force may exchange a chainsword for a chainaxe for no additional points cost.

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: The Dark Void Elite, Legatine Axes

rules.name: Legatine Axes
rules.description: Any model with both the Independent Character and Chapter Tactics (Marines Errant) special rules may exchange a Chainsword or a Close Combat Weapon for a Legatine Axe for +20 points, or a power weapon for +10 points.

rules.name: The Dark Void Elite
rules.description:
Up to 3 of any of the following units may be upgraded to the Dark Void Elite:
- Sternguard Veteran Squad
- Tactical Squad
- Devastator Squad
- Character and their Retinue
for +20 points a squad. Any unit so upgraded gains the Deep Strike Special Rule and the Heavy unit Sub-type.

rules.name: Master Artisan
rules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Salamanders) and the Character unit sub-type may upgrade their weapon to have the Master-Crafted special rule for +10 points.

rules.name: First Founding Chapter
rules.description: A Salamanders Detachment may include up to 2 additional Relics of the Chapter on top of what is usually allowed by points limits or any other special rules.

rules.name: Sons of Pyroclasts
rules.description: A Salamanders Devastator Squad that is entirely equipped Heavy Flamers (sans the sergeant) may be upgraded to Sons of the Pyroclasts for +10 points a model. All models must be upgraded. Each member of that squad gains +1W and the It Will Not Die (5+) Special Rule.

rules.name: Mantle of the Elder Drake
rules.description: A Single model in an army with both the Chapter Tactics (Salamanders) special rule and the Character sub-type may take the Manlte of the Eldar Drake for +25 points. This gives the model the the Eternal Warrior special rule, in addition, if wounded by a weapon with the Brutal (X) rule, -1 from the Brutal (X) rule to a minimum of 1.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Blood of Fire, Master Artisan, First Founding Chapter

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Sons of Pyroclasts, Mantle of the Elder Drake

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Strike from the Shadows, Legendary Marksmen

rules.name: Reconnaissance Squad
rules.description: Any Tactical Squad with the Chapter Tactics (Raptors) Special rule may be upgraded to a Reconnaissance Squad for 6 points a model. All models in a squad must be upgraded. A Reconnaissance Squad gains the Outflank and Fatal Strike Special Rules. In addition, the squad also gains Shroud Bombs.

rules.name: Fatal Strike
rules.description: Once per game, a Raptor Reconnaissance Squad may execute a fatal strike attack against a chosen target. The Reconnaissance Squad’s controlling player declares the Fatal strike at the start of one of the squad’s Shooting phases. For the duration of that phase, the squad’s shooting attacks have both the Twin-linked and Rending (6+) special rules, in addition to any other effects their weapons might have. In the case of weapons already with the Rending (X) Special rule, increase it by 1,eg during the Fatal Strike a weapon with Rending (6+) would go to Rending (5+) for the duration of the attack.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Unrelenting Assault, Trample and Crush, Vaults of Terra

rules.name: Hecaton Dreadnoughts
rules.description: Contemptor Dreadnoughts with the Chapter Tactics (Minotaurs) special rule may be taken in Talons of 2 instead of the usual 1 and receive the Dreadnought Talon special rule.

rules.name: Sacred-band
rules.description: 0-1 squad of Minotaurs Terminators may be upgraded to Sacred Band for +10 points a model. All models must be upgraded. A Sacred Band Terminator adds +1 to its WS, and gains the Preferred Enemy (Space Marines) Special Rule.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Reavers of the Outer Darkness, Blood Hunger, Blooded (X)

rules.name: Reavers of the Outer Darkness
rules.description: All models with Chapter Tactics (Carcharodons) may exchange a boltgun they are already equipped with for a close combat weapon for free or a chainsword for +1 point. Any model may also choose to equip an additional close combat weapon for +1 point or chainsword for +2 points per model.

rules.name: The Red Brethren
rules.description: One Terminator Squad with the Chapter Tactics (Carcharodons) Special rule that is equipped entirely with lightning claws may be upgraded to the Red Brethren for +10 points a model. The Red Brethren gain +1WS, and Battle Hardened (1) and replace their lightning claws with letting-talons.

rules.name: Enochian Guard
rules.description: 0-1 Terminator Command Squads, Terminator Squads, or Vanguard Veteran Squads with the Chapter Tactics (Exorcists) Special Rule may be upgraded to Enochian Guard at +15 points a model. They Gain the Adamantium Will (4+) Special rule as well as the Psyker Unit (Sub-Type) and may Exchange a Power Fist/Power Weapon for a Force Weapon for free.

rules.name: Asphyx Shells
rules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Exorcists) Special rule may upgrade their Bolt Pistol or Boltgun/Boltgun part of combi-weapon/storm bolter for +1 point a model, or Heavy Bolter for +2 points a model. This may also upgrade twin-linked/gravis variants of these weapons for double the above points. If this model is part of a unit, the entire unit must be upgraded in such a fashion. Any weapon upgraded in such a way gains the Shred special rule.

rules.name: 1st Company Veteran Elite
rules.description: A unit of Fire Angels Terminators may be upgraded to 1st Company Veteran Elite for 10 points a model. This unit increases its WS by 1. In addition, these models gain the Hatred (Secessionists) special rule.

rules.name: Terranic Greatswords
rules.description: Any model with both the Independent Character and Chapter Tactics (Fire Angels) special rules may exchange a Power Fist for a Terranic Greatsword for no additional cost.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: On Wings of Fire, Speed and Fury, The Livery of Curs

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: MkIII Iron Armour Stores, Flame and Fury

rules.name: MkIII Iron Armour Stores
rules.description: Any Infantry units with the Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks) Special rule that is in either Power Armour or Artificer armour may upgrade the entire units armour to MK III Iron Armour for +2 points a model. This gives the unit the Heavy Sub-Type and must be modelled appropriately.

rules.name: Flame and Fury
rules.description: Any model in an Infantry with the Chapter Tactics (Fire Hawks) Special Rule may exchange their boltgun for a handflamer for +2 points. If they do not have a boltgun, an Infantry unit may exchange their Bolt Pistol for a Hand Flamer for +3 points.

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Mancoran Lineage, Hardened Battle-psykers, Griffon Warblades

rules.name: Mancoran Lineage
rules.description: A Howling Griffons Detachment may take any number of the Codicier Librarian Chapter Specialists upgrades, ignoring the usual limitation of 1.

rules.name: Hardened Battle-psykers
rules.description: Any Codicier Librarian with the Chapter Tactics (Howling Griffons) special rule may be upgraded to an Epistolary Librarian for +25 points. This allows them to know up two different psychic disciplines chosen from those available to them.

rules.name: Griffon Warblades
rules.description: Any model with both the Character Sub-Type and Chapter Tactics (Howling Griffons) special rules with access to a power sword as part of their Wargear options may instead take a Griffon Warblade for + 5 points instead.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: The Strength of Wisdom, 2nd Founding, Wealth of Ages

rules.name: 2nd Founding
rules.description: A Novamarines Detachment may include an additional Relic of the Chapter on top of what is usually allowed by points limits or any other special rules. They may also include an additional Elite Slot, but it may only be used on a Terminator Squad or Castraferrum Dreadnought.

rules.name: Wealth of Ages
rules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Novamarines) Special that does not have the Character Sub-Type or Independant Character Special Rule may chose to replace either a Close Combat Weapon/Chainsword or Boltgun with a Power Sword for +5 points each.

rules.name: Storm Chasers
rules.description: A Novamarines Terminator Squad may be upgraded to Storm Chasers for 10 points a model. A Storm Chasers Squad gains the Iron Bulwark and Stubborn Special Rule.

rules.name: Iron Bulwark
rules.description: If a unit includes at least three models with the Iron Bulwark Special rule and is not locked in combat, all friendly models in that unit (including those without Iron Bulwark) gain the Battle-Hardened (1) Special Rule for the duration of any Assault Phase in which they charge or are charged by one or more enemy units.

rules.name: Purity Above All
rules.description: Any Tactical, Boarding, Siege Assault, Assault or Devastator squad’s Sergeant or Veteran Sergeant with Chapter Tactics (Red Scorpions) may be made a member of the Chapter’s expansive Apothecarion and upgraded to carry a Narthecium for +20 points a model. This does not otherwise alter their wargear, additional options or profile, and should always be appropriately represented on the model.

rules.name: Anphelion Veterans
rules.description: A single Terminator Command Squad, Terminator Squad, Vanguard Veteran Squad, or Sternguard Veteran Squad may be upgraded to Anphelion Veterans for +8 points a model. They each increase their Ballistic Skill by +1 and the entire units Bolt and Auto weapons gain the Poison (2+) special rule. They also gain the Move Through Cover and Night Vision Special Rules.

rules.name: Honour Guard
rules.description:
A Command Squad or Vanguard Veteran Squad may be upgraded to an Honour Guard for +5 points a model. All models must be upgraded as such. An Honour Guard squad gains the Cloaked in Honour Special Rule.


There may only be as many Honour Guard Squads as there are models with the Independent Character Special Rule and each squad must have an Independent Character attached to them.

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Purity Above All, Anphelion Veterans, Honour Guard

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Legion Space Marine Cohort, Iron Hunter Squadron, Retaliator Squad, Corpse Taker Vivisectors, Dark Harvest, Legion Centurion, The Tyrant's Will

rules.name: Legion Space Marine Cohort
rules.description: Astral Claws Tactical Squads may take up to 15 additional Tactical Marines, up to a maximum of 20 Tactical Marines.

rules.name: Iron Hunter Squadron
rules.description: Any Space Marine Bike Squad can be upgraded to Iron Hunters at +10 points per model. This Increases all models Weapon Skill and Wounds Characteristics by +1 and gives them both the Counter-Attack (1) and Move Through Cover Special Rules.

rules.name: Retaliator Squad
rules.description: An Astral Claws Siege Assault squad can be upgraded to Retaliators for +5 points a model. The unit loses the Tip of the Spear Special rule, but gains the Heavy unit sub-type as well as the Furious Charge (1) and Fear (1) Special rules.

rules.name: Corpse Take Vivsectors
rules.description:
Any Apothecary may be upgraded to a Corpse-Taker Vivisector for +25 points a
model. Any such upgraded Apothecaries gain +1 wound, Fear (1) and the Dark
Harvest special rule.

rules.name: Legion Centurion
rules.description:
- A Company Captain may be upgraded to an Arch-Centurion for +30 points
- A Force Commander may be upgraded to a Centurion for +20 point
- A Legion Arch-Centurion/Centurion and all models in a unit he joins gains the Hatred (Loyalists) special rule
In addition, the Legion Arch-Centurion/Centurion gains the The Tyrant’s Will Special Rule.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Shadow Killers, Children of Prophecy, Maelstrom Warder

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Tranquility Veterans, Guardians of the Endymion Cluster

rules.name: Children of Prophecy
rules.description: A force whose primary detachment has Chapter Tactics (Mantis Warriors) may reroll failed attempts to Seize the Initiative where this is a factor in the mission being played.

rules.name: Tranquility Veterans
rules.description: Any Sternguard Veteran Squad may be upgraded to Tranquillity Veterans for +12 Points a model. They all gain Sniper Rifles in addition to their standard weapons, as well as the Scout Special Rule and the Skirmish unit sub-type.

rules.name: Guardians of the Endymion Cluster
rules.description: Any Tactical Squad or Assault Squad with the Chapter Tactics (Mantis Warriors) special rule may be upgraded to Guardians of the Endymion Cluster for +4 points a model. Members of this Squad gain the Deep Strike, Sudden Strike, and Fateful Appearance Special Rules.

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Sons of the Gorgon, Iron Fathers, Cyber-familiar

rules.name: True Sons
rules.description: All shooting attacks made against a model with this special rule that does not have the Vehicle Unit Type, suffer a modifier of -1 to the strength of the attack.

rules.name: Maletek-exorcism Reclamation Protocols
rules.description: A Sons of Medusa Detachment may include an additional Relic of the Chapter on top of what is usually allowed by points limits or any other special rules.

rules.name: Sons of the Gorgon
rules.description: A Sons of Medusa Terminators Squad may be upgraded to a Gorgon Squad for +12 points a model. All models in the squad must be upgraded. Gorgon Terminators gain the Feel no Pain (5+) and Stubborn, special rule.

rules.name: Iron Fathers
rules.description:
Any Sons of Medusa Company Captain/ Company Captain in Terminator Armour or Force Commander/ Force Commander in Terminator Armour may be upgraded to an Iron-Father for +65 points.


An Iron Father gains the benefits below: Battlesmith (3+) and Feel No Pain (5+) Special Rules and a Machinator Array and Cyber-Familiar Wargear. An Iron-Father may not select a Warhawk Jump Pack or Astartes Combat Bike.

rules.name: Cyber-familiar
rules.description: Any model with the Chapter Tactics (Sons of Medusa Special rule and the Character Unit Sub-Type may take a cyber-familiar for 20 points.

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Orbital Wave Attack, Hail of Destruction, Unfettered Destruction

characteristics.name: Unit Upgrades
characteristics.$text: Chapter Mortuary Cult Imperialis, Badab Assault Force

rules.name: Chapter Mortuary Cult Imperialis
rules.description: Any Chapter Apothecary may be upgraded to a Mortuary Chaplain for free. If done so must exchange their Narthecium for a Master-Crafted Power Maul and both they and their unit gain the Hatred (Everything!) Special Rule.

rules.name: Badab Assault Force
rules.description: Any unit consisting wholly of the Infantry Type with the Chapter Tactics (Star Phantoms) special rule may be upgraded to the Badab Assault Force for +20 points a squad. If so upgraded, each squad gains Breacher Charges and the Move Through Cover and Deep Strike special rules.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The controlling player may choose to have a model with krak grenades that is Engaged or otherwise in base contact during the Assault phase with a Building or Fortification, or a model with the Vehicle, Dreadnought or Automata Unit Type, inflict one automatic Str 6, AP 3 Hit on the target in Initiative Step 1 instead of attacking normally. Any model in a unit that is chosen to inflict Hits using krak grenades may not otherwise attack or make use of any other special rule or item of Wargear that inflicts Hits or Wounds on a model in the same Assault phase (but may participate in Sweeping Advances as normal).

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a Targeter increases their Ballistic Skill by 1.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he has joined may reroll charge distance when charging into existing combat where a model (on either side) has already been slain. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins is completely immune to any psychic attacks or weapons. He may never join a unit with the Psyker sub-type for any reason (Meaning he cannot take a retinue of Enochian Guard). While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While the Warlord is embarked on a vehicle, any other vehicle within 12" of the Warlords’ Vehicle may increase its move characteristic by +2". While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: While the Warlord is alive, the controlling player may reroll all 1’s when rolling for reserves. The Warlord and his unit may also re-roll their charge moves on a turn they arrive from reserve. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and all friendly units within 6", add +1 to their initiative for any Run moves or Movement Reactions. While the Warlord is alive, the controlling player may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and all friendly units within 6", add +1 to their results when rolling for charge distance. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins gain the Deep Strike Special rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and any unit he joins gains both the Line Sub-Type and the Heart of the Chapter Special Rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins gains the Shrouded (6+) Special Rule, this may stack with any other version of the shrouded rule eg. Shrouded (5+) from Evade goes to Shrouded (4+) etc. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and all friendly units within 12", add +1 to their results when rolling for charge distance. In addition, while the warlord is alive the army may make an additional reaction in the movement phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and his unit may Run and still make Snap Shots with any Melta, Plasma or Flame Weaponry they carry (Template Weapons go to D3 hits if in range). While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit he joins gains the Battle Hardened (1) Special Rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Shooting Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and unit he joins lose the One Shot rule from any Combi-melta or Combi-plasma weapons the unit carries. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Assault Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord and any unit with 12" of him that is within 3" of an objective count their Leadership as 1 higher than usual, to a maximum of 10.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and up to 3 units may be given the Outflank special rule. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The warlord and any unit he joins automatically passes Pinning tests. While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: The Warlord Gains the Precision Strike (2+) Special Rule. The Warlord and any unit he joins gains the Shrouded (6+) Special rule while within cover. This stacks with other forms of Shrouded (X). While the warlord is alive, the army may make an additional reaction in the Movement Phase.
